Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Biden's statement by stating that he said he "will not be president for very long" if elected, whereas he actually said that his vice presidential nominee should be prepared to step into the presidency "if something happened."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that Biden hinted to donors that he may not be able to carry out his presidential term due to poor health.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that Biden's statement about choosing a vice presidential nominee who is prepared to be president implies that he will not be president for very long, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation for Biden's statement, clarifying that he was referring to the need for a vice presidential nominee who is ready to take on the presidency in case of unforeseen circumstances, not implying that he will not be president for long.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Biden did not explicitly say that he "will not be president for very long" if elected.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
